io.github.thatsmusic99.configurationmaster

Class CMFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thatsmusic99.configurationmaster.CMFile

  • public abstract class CMFile
extends java.lang.Object
    CMFile is the specialised configuration file used by ConfigurationMaster to carry out all of the required tasks in creating a config file.

    It can be initialised by extending the class or using the provided constructors below.

    You will be required to add all default values within the loadDefaults() method, which should be added anyways due to it being an abstract method. This is so that all processes can be kept in one place - failure to do this results in a NullPointerException, since the plugin has not created the actual files yet, this rejects them.

    Following initialisation, setters such as setTitle(String) and addLink(String, String) can be called to toggle any options provided by the class. Once this is all done, you need to call load(), which starts generating all the options and comments.

    To reload the configuration file, call reload() or load(). Both do the same thing, but reload() is used for the sake of naming conventions and to make it easier for others to use and understand.
    Author:
    Holly (Thatsmusic99)

    • Method Detail

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads the config file.
        See Also:
        load()

      • load

        public void load()
        Prompts the config to initiate CM's loading process. The process is as follows:
        • Create the config file - and required folder - if necessary.
        • Load all existing options into the config to be read from.
        • Load all the defaults.
        • Moving all old options to their new ones.
        • Saves defaults to the configuration file.
        • Loads the config header.
        • Writes all comments.
        • Saves the final results.
        • Anything required to happen post-save happens.
        See Also:
        loadDefaults(), moveTo(String, String), moveToNew(), loadTitle(), writeComments(), postSave()

      • loadTitle

        public void loadTitle()
        Loads the title of the config file.

        It handles the following elements in order:
        • The title
        • The subtitle
        • The description
        • Any external links

      • getMaxTitleWidth

        public int getMaxTitleWidth()
        The maximum width the title can go up to. If there are no external links, then 75 is returned by default. However, if there are external links, the title is expanded to hold it.
        Returns:
        The number of characters wide the title can be.
        See Also:
        getDefaultTitleWidth(), setDefaultTitleWidth(int)

      • getDefaultTitleWidth

        public int getDefaultTitleWidth()
        The title width that is set by default.
        This is the minimum of what the header can be; it can be altered by external links. This is to stop the links being broken up and unusable.
        Returns:
        The number of characters wide the title can be by default. This is set to 75.
        See Also:
        setDefaultTitleWidth(int), getMaxTitleWidth()

      • getTitle

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getTitle()
        The title used at the top of the config file.
        Returns:
        The title to be used. By default, it returns -<( PLUGIN NAME )>-
        See Also:
        setTitle(String)

      • getLinkSeparator

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String getLinkSeparator()
        The characters used to separate external sources and their links.
        Returns:
        The characters that separate sources and links. Be default, it returns " - "
        See Also:
        setLinkSeparator(String)

      • getSubtitle

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getSubtitle()
        The subtitle displayed under the plugin title.
        Returns:
        The subtitle to be used. By default, it returns "Made by XXX, YYY and ZZZ" where XXX, YYY and ZZZ are plugin developers. The default value adjusts to the number of plugin developers listed.
        See Also:
        setSubtitle(String)

      • getDescription

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getDescription()
        The description underneath the title and subtitle of the config.
        Returns:
        The description to be used. By default, it uses the plugin's description from the plugin.yml file.
        See Also:
        setDescription(String)

      • getExternalLinks

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getExternalLinks()
        A list of external sources with their links to them.
        Returns:
        A hashmap of the sources and links. The key is the source name itself, such as "Github", and the value is the link, e.g. "https://github.com".
        See Also:
        addLink(String, String), removeLink(String)

      • setDefaultTitleWidth

        public void setDefaultTitleWidth(int defaultTitleWidth)
        Sets the default title width to a different minimum.
        Parameters:
        defaultTitleWidth - The minimum to be set to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided width is shorter than 20 characters. Having a width of at least 20 characters ensures that the header can be formatted correctly. This limit may be removed - or reduced - once the justified alignment is introduced.
        See Also:
        getDefaultTitleWidth(), getMaxTitleWidth()

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • loadDefaults

        public abstract void loadDefaults()
        The method where all default values, comments and sections should be added inside.
        See Also:
        addComment(String), addComment(String, String), addDefault(String, Object), addDefault(String, Object, String), addDefault(String, Object, String, String), addExample(String, Object), addExample(String, Object, String), addSection(String)

      • addDefault

        public void addDefault(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a default value to a specified path. If the path already exists, the value will not be used.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the value to be set.
        value - The actual value itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the config has not been initialised yet.
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.addDefault(String, Object)

      • addExample

        public void addExample(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        Adds an example option.

        Functions the same as addDefault(String, Object), however the default is only added if the config is brand new. The value will not be used either if the path already exists.

        It serves the purpose of providing a user with an example option to use within a ConfigurationSection for example.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the option to be set.
        value - The example value.
        See Also:
        addDefault(String, Object)

      • addExample

        public void addExample(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Object value,
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Adds an example option with a comment included.

        Functions the same as addDefault(String, Object, String), however the default and comment is only added if the config is brand new. The value will not be used either if the path already exists.

        It serves the purpose of providing a user with an example option to use within a ConfigurationSection for example.

        To make a comment multiple lines, use \n.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the option to be set.
        value - The example value.
        comment - The comment to be included.
        See Also:
        addDefault(String, Object, String)

      • addLenientSection

        public void addLenientSection(@NotNull
                              java.lang.String path)
        Creates what is considered to be a "lenient" section.

        Because ConfigurationMaster is very strict with what the user adds and removes, a lenient section lets them add and remove what they like.

        An example usage of this is in AdvancedTeleport when creating per-world spawning and teleportation rules.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the section.

      • set

        public void set(@NotNull
                java.lang.String path,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a specific value to a specified path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the option to be set.
        value - The actual value itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the config has not been initialised yet.
        See Also:
        MemorySection.set(String, Object)

      • addDefault

        public void addDefault(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Object value,
                       @NotNull
                       java.lang.String section,
                       @NotNull
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Adds a default value to a specified path, in addition to a comment and section. If the path already exists, the value will not be used. The comment and section are still added regardless.

        To make a comment multiple lines, use \n.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the option to be set.
        value - The actual value itself.
        section - The section that the option will be put under.
        comment - The comment that is placed above the option.
        See Also:
        addDefault(String, Object), addSection(String), addComment(String)

      • addDefault

        public void addDefault(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Object value,
                       @NotNull
                       java.lang.String comment)
        Adds a default value to a specified path, in addition to a comment. If the path already exists, the value will not be used. The comment is still added regardless.

        To make a comment multiple lines, use \n.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the option to be set.
        value - The actual value itself.
        comment - The comment that is placed above the option.
        See Also:
        addDefault(String, Object), addComment(String)

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(@NotNull
                   java.lang.String oldPath,
                   @NotNull
                   java.lang.String newPath)
        Moves an option from an old path to a new one. Afterwards, the old path is removed.
        Parameters:
        oldPath - the currently existing path that needs to be moved.
        newPath - the new path to be moved to.
